news uk-news new-highway-code-rules-mean-"New DVLA rules and driving laws coming in ByGraeme Murray:,  Mar Updated:,  Mar |comments You could face a fine for using a mobile evenyouaposre a passenger under new Highway Code rules.Drivers who even touch a phone face could be hit with a £ penalty after tough new rules came into effect on Friday. If a person is supervising a driver who is learning, they could be hit with £, fine - as well as a massive six points on their licence. Current rules under the Highway Code make texting or calling while driving illegal. But new rules brought in on Friday means many grey areas have been tightened, making more actions illegal. In , it was ruled in the High Court that an offence was committed when a mobile was used for an interactive communication .  This included calling or texting, but now using a phone for any purpose, is seen as reckless and dangerous. Now drivers can no longer touch their device, take photos or videos, access playlists or use other apps while they drive. Phone use at traffic lights or in motorway queues will also be seen as illegal under new Highway Code rules. Anyone using a device while driving faces a £ fixed fine plus six points added to their driving licence. Motorists are, however, permitted to use their phones to pay at a drive-thru restaurant or a road or bridge toll. The Department of Transport : There will be an exemption to the new law for drivers making a contactless payment using their mobile phone while stationary to ensure the law keeps pace with technology.This exemption will cover, for example, places like a drive-through restaurant or a road toll, and will only apply when payment is being made with a card reader. It will not allow motorists to make general online payments while driving. Hands-free devices can be used when driving including taking calls or using a satnav, but onlyit is secured in something which holds it. news uk-news pharmacy-worker-complains-i-see-"Woman warns people about printing ‘nudes’ at CVSByTfany LoVideo News ReporterKit Roberts:,  Mar |comments An employee at a pharmacy and health and beauty retailer has implored people to stop using the shop to print out their nude photos. CVS employee Mariah took to TikTok and revealed that she has seen customers printing off their private snaps at nine in the morning on the storeaposs printing facilities. Unfortunately, it means that she and the storeaposs other employees have to see the full brunt of the clienteleaposs private lives, the Daily Star reports.This is even worsean order is placed online, as Mariah has to sort through the pictures and make sure the right ones get printed out. She told her TikTok followers of her dilemma, donning her red unorm and yellow lanyard for the video.Where do you print your pictures  Let us know in the comment section  Mariah, from New York City told viewers: I donapost know how many times I have to say this. Donapost print your nudes at CVS.I do, in fact, see every single one. The -year-old worker joked about calling out one of her customers in particular, commenting: Please it’s am Lauren I can’t do this. Some viewers were shocked to find out about the shopaposs printing service, with one commenting: So CVS saw my daughteraposs entire birth.I left my sister in charge of pictures with a disposable camera. I had no idea until I went to pick them up at CVS and saw all the workers face. Others said they prefer to use online printing services and have the photos delivered to home to avoid face-to-face embarrassment. I will just use Shutterfly, easy, a viewer said. Mariah explained that she can only see customersapos photos when they place online orders.  Get the stories you want straight to your inbox.toone of the Mirroraposs newslettersShe replied: If you print them in store, I donapost see them butyou do an online order, I am the one manually printing them out and packing them. If you do [want to print nudes], do it yourself. Earlier this month, a Boots employee saved a woman to escape from her controlling husband. She walked into the shop using the code ask for Ani — meaning she needed help and assistance from the police. When the officer arrived, they arrested the womanaposs husband, who later pleaded guilty to controlling and coercive behaviour and assault causing actual bodily harm. title: prince philips poignant last requests
story: Prince Philips poignant last requests will finally be honoured at memorial serviceSome of Prince Philips wishes for his funeral service that could not be fulfilled due to Covid- restrictions at the time of his final farewell will finally be granted at his memorial service later todayPrince Philips memorial service takes place at Westminster Abbey later today Image: Getty ImagesByJenner NewtonRoyal Features Writer:,  Mar Updated:,  Mar |commentsSeveral of Prince Philipaposs poignant last requests will finally be honoured at his memorial service later today. When the Duke of Edinburgh, the beloved husband of the Queen, died last April aged , England was still in the grip of restrictions due to the Covid- pandemic. This meant his funeral, held on April  at St Georgeaposs Chapel in Windsor, was a much scaled-back service, with just  guests and no singing by the guests. It had been Philipaposs express wishes for the congregation to join and sing the rousing hymn Guide Me, O Thou Great Redeemer at his funeral.  Although the hymn was sung by a small choir, guests at his funeral were not allowed to join in. However, today, this request will finally be fulfilled at todayaposs service when the ,-strong congregation sing the hymn. In addition, Philip, who worked on his own funeral details – codenamed Forth Bridge – for many years, had asked for the choir to sing Te Deum in C by Benjamin Britten, and this will also be part of Tuesday’s proceedings.  Love the royals for the Mirroraposs daily newsletter to get all the latest news on the Queen, Charles, Kate, Wills, Meghan, Harry and the rest of The Firm. Click here to sign up . Meanwhile, clergy from Windsor, Sandringham and Balmoral will all play a special part in the service - at Philipaposs request. Philip had an active role in the day-to-day management of the estates for many years. He wanted the minister of Crathie Church near Balmoral, the rector of Sandringham and the chaplain to the Royal Chapel of All Saints, Windsor Great Park, to take part in his funeral - but Covid restrictions could not allow this.  Nearly all members of the Royal Family will be attending todayaposs event, including Prince Andrew, who will arrive alongside his daughters Princess Beatrice and Princess Eugenie, and their husbands Edoardo Mapelli Mozzi and Jack Brooksbank. Also there will be Prince Charles, Camilla, the Duke and Duchess of Cambridge, the Earl and Countess of Wessex and their children Lady Louise Windsor and Viscount Severn, the Princess Royal and Vice Admiral Sir Tim Laurence, Prince and Princess Michael of Kent, the Duke of Kent and the Duke and Duchess of Gloucester.  However, Prince Harry and Meghan Markle are not ing from the US for the service.Around  foreign royals will attend, including Prince Albert of Monaco, Denmark’s Queen Margrethe and Spain’s King Felipe VI and Queen Letizia, who would have originally been on the pre-pandemic guest list. Also invited are Sir David Attenborough, Dame Floella Benjamin, Baroness Grey-Thompson and members of the military who were involved in the funeral, including Pipe Major Colour Sergeant Peter Grant and the Grenadier Guards Bearer Party. title: queen hunt ambitious new chef
story: Queen on the hunt for ambitious new chef willing to travel with herThe chef lucky enough to bag the once-in-a-letime opportunity, will have all meals provided and accommodationneeded. The role which is based in Buckingham Palace, includes working with quality ingredientsThe Demi Chef de Partie will be based at Buckingham Palace Image: Tim Graham Photo Library via Getty ImagesBySamantha Mordi:,  Mar |commentsIf you have ever thought your cooking is good enough for royalty, now is the chance to prove your skills. The Queen is on the hunt for an ambitious new chef who is willing to travel with her. The Demi Chef de Partie will be based at Buckingham Palace - but must be willing to cook at other Royal residences such as Balmoral and the Palace of Holyroodhouse. The lucky chef to bag the once-in-a-letime opportunity will get get accommodation,needed and all meals provided. A statement on the Royal website reads: Joining an accomplished team of professionals, youaposll work hands-on to deliver food to the highest standards. Youaposll prepare erse menus for a wide range of events, learning essential skills that will provide stepping stones for a great career.  Working with quality ingredients and alongside skilled colleagues, your role will be erse, rotating through all sections of the kitchen. And in an environment where development and training is commonplace, youaposll be supported to grow within your role. As youaposd expect, standards are exceptionally high here, and every day is busy, so youaposll need to be an ambitious and qualied chef. The new chef is expected to have worked within a premier kitchen or volume catering environment and have the ability and enthusiasm to deliver across all sections of the kitchen.  Other key skills for the role include working well in a team, having strong communication skills and being adaptable. Alongside this, the new post-holder should have attention to detail and being able to meet deadlines, as well as cooking slap-up meals for Her Majesty. The job advert continues: Most importantly though, you have a clear passion for food and the catering industry, and will be eager to learn new skills.  Inyou can look forward to working in a unique and stimulating work environment, and be rewarded with a comprehensive benefits package, including  days holiday, % employer contribution pension scheme. The role also offers numerous training and development with a range of recreational facilities. No salary is mentioned but is said to be competitive. news uk-news school-run-mum-admits-using-"Insulate Britain: Woman appears to drive car into protesterByAlahna KindredNews Reporter:,  Mar |comments A mum has admitted to using her Range Rover to try and move an Insulate Britain protester who was blocking the road while she was on the school run.Sherrilyn Speid, , appeared at Southend Magistratesapos Court today and pleaded guilty to a charge of dangerous driving.The mum from Essex had been at the wheel of her black Range Rover Sport when she came across an Insulate Britain protest in Grays at about .am last October. The scene was caught on camera by a passer-by and heavily-bleeped footage was shown in court. Prosecutor Ashley Petchey said three protesters were sitting across the road and queues of traffic had built up behind them.  Speid got out of her vehicle and remonstrated with the demonstrators, the court heard. A woman is seen telling the protesters they must move out of the way now and my son needs to go to school and I need to go to work. She also says: My son is  and he needs to go to school. Of the dangerous driving count, Mr Petchey said: It is not an excessive speed as the driver was using the brakes quite heavily. This is done on two occasions.  The Range Rover stops very close to the female protester. Mr Petchey said the dangerous driving meant that injury could have been caused. He said: Clearly this was an incident where there was a risk, evenno injury was caused. An assault charge against Speid, in which it was alleged that protester Bethany Mogie had been beaten, was dismissed after the prosecution said it would produce no evidence.The prosecution said it would ask for £ in costs and a pre-sentence report was ordered. Peter Hoche, chairman of the bench, unconditionally bailed Speid to next appear at Basildon Magistratesapos Court on May  for sentencing. He also banned Speid from driving by issuing her with an interim driving disqualication. At the height of the Insulate Britain road-blocking protests, Speid attempted to move the activists with her Range Rover.  “What they’re doing is wrong, she said afterwards. They’re not peaceful, they’re obstructive and they’re rude, she continued. I’m upset I lost my temper and maybe I could’ve gone about it in a dferent way but I will always stand up for what I believe in — that people should be entitled to live their normal lives. She said at the time that she was standing up for other mums who needed to take their children to school in the mornings. Insulate Britain has demanded that the government invest money in making Britainaposs homes less leaky and cold, in a bid to save energy and therefore protect the environment. title: second po ferry detained over
story: Second PO ferry is detained over safety concerns after firm sacked The Maritime and Coastguard Agency has confirmed that it is holding PO ferry The Pride of Kent following a safety inspection, after another ferry was detained last FridayThe Pride of Kent ferry has now been detained Image: PAByTim HanlonNews Reporter:,  Mar |commentsA second PO ferry has been detained following a safety inspection on the back of the firm sacking  staff so as to bring in cheaper agency workers. The Maritime and Coastguard Agencyhas said after undertaking a safety inspection it was in the process of holding The Pride of Kent on Monday.The firm sparked outrage with protests at ports around the country after getting rid of  seafarers without giving notice on March .PO boss Peter Hebblethwaite will appear before a Scottish Parliament committee on Tuesday, after he was heavily criticised over the job cuts.Now a spokesperson for the MCA confirmed that the Pride of Kent was being held.  They said: Our surveyors are in the process of detaining the Pride of Kent. We are awaiting confirmation of all the detainable items.Transport Secretary Grant Shapps confirmed the news in a tweet, adding that the ship was being held following an inspection and that safety will not be compromised.It follows the detention of another PO vessel which was held in the Northern Ireland port of Larne on Friday due to failures on crew familiarisation, vessel documentation and crew training. The Rail, Maritime and Transport union said it believed the MCA acted because of multiple safety and operational breaches, including the wearing of breathing apparatus. The union repeated its demand that the Government seize POaposs entire fleet and take action to get them back in service with the sacked crew reinstated.  General secretary Mick Lynch said: The seizing of the Pride of Kent by the MCA this evening should be adequate evidence for the Government that the gangster capitalist outfit PO are not fit and proper to run a safe service after the jobs massacre. Itaposs rare enough for the MCA to impound a ferry but PO have now had two in a week after the jobs carve up which speaks volumes about the dire state of their operation. Itaposs now high time for these important vessels to be taken over under public control with the sacked crews reinstated as the only way to get these crucial ferry routes back running safely. The MCA said another of the firmaposs vessels, European Causeway, remains under detention in Larne. Shapps wrote to Mr Hebblethwaite earlier on Monday threatening to bring a package of measures to Parliament to block the company from paying below minimum wage. Through that package, I intend to block the outcome that PO Ferries has pursued, including paying workers less than the minimum wage, he said.  The measures could be unveiled on Wednesday. The minimum wage in the UK for people aged  and above is £. per hour. Mr Hebblethwaite, whose basic annual salary is £,, told MPs on March  the average pay of the agency crew is £. per hour. He will face the Net Zero, Energy and Transport Committee on Tuesday after he appeared before a Westminster committee last week. Irish Ferries began operating on the Dover to Calais route in June  in competition with PO Ferries. A PO Ferries spokesman reportedly said: We fully welcome the Governmentaposs commitment to increasing the minimum wage for all seafarers working in British waters. From the outset, we have called for a level playing field when it comes to pay and conditions on British ferry routes. Our announcement is not about reducing seafareraposs wages, it is to enable us to have a fully flexible crewing model that allows us to meet the demands of our customers. The predicted savings we announced are not solely coming from the reduction in wages, but from removing job duplication and the benefits we will see from increased flexibility. title: two early covid omicron symptoms
story: Two early Covid Omicron symptoms - and how to tell them apart from a coldAs Covid cases continue to rise, experts have identied two early Omicron symptoms that are distinct to the iant and could help you distinguish it from a coldOmicron symptoms are very similar to a cold and can be hard to tell apart Image: Getty ImagesByMalvika PadinTrends Writer:,  Mar |comments Itaposs become a bit of a habit for most of us to ask ourselveswe have Covid every time we feel poorly. With the Omicron iant giving rise to sub-iants like stealth Omicron and Deltacron, and ious symptoms becoming linked to the dferent iants of the virus, it can be hard to tellyouaposre suffering from Covid or just a cold.Knowingyou have Covid or a cold has become particularly dficult because the Omicron iant has symptoms that y from the classic three signs of Covid and instead overlap with symptoms of a cold. However, experts have identied two early signs that points towards you having Covid. What two symptoms are early signs of Omicron   Two early signs of Omicron, that are dferent to the main symptoms identied by the NHS, have been identied as fatigue and dizziness or fainting.Fatigue is not just feeling tired. It can be accompanied by other symptoms like headaches as well as body pain due to weak or sore muscles. Sometimes it even leads to blurred vision and loss of appetite.Dr Angelique Coetzee, who was the doctor to first raise the alarm on Omicron in South Africa - where the iant was first discovered in November  - also highlighted fatigues as one of the main signs of Omicron.  The second early symptom of Omicron is dizziness, which could potentially lead to fainting. This connection between fainting spells and Covid was first noted by a German newspaper Arztezeitung. The possibility of fainting being a Covid symptom was first discovered by doctors in Berlin, who found that Covid was triggering recurrent fainting spells in a -year-old hospital patient. What are the common symptoms of Omicron  According to the NHS, the main symptoms of Covid are still a high temperature, a new continuous cough and a loss of taste smell. However, the signs of Omicron have been found to be vastly dferent from the classic three signs of Covid established previously. A study in the infectious disease and epidemiology journal, Eurosurveillance, identied eight key symptoms of the Omicron iant. These included cough, runny nose, sore throat, headache, muscle pain, fever and sneezing. Of these the first three symptoms were found to be the most common.What to doyou have Covid   According to government advice, you are no longer by law required to self isolateyou test positive for Covid.However, the NHS still recommends you stay at home and avoid contact with othersyou have symptoms. The advice currently states: While you’re no longer legally required to self-isolateyou have Covid-, you should try to stay at home and away from others to avoid passing on the virus.The NHS recommends you stay away and avoid contactyou have any of the main symptoms of Covid- or have tested positive for Covid-. It is recommended you take rapid lateral flow tests from five days after your symptoms start, and the next day. If both your tests are negative and you donapost have a fever youaposre less likely to pass on Covid to others. title: uk weather forecast arctic blast
story: UK weather forecast: Arctic blast brings widespread snowfall and -C freezeA week after the UK basked in C temperatures an Arctic blast could see the mercury tumble as low as -C and there is expected to be widespread snow across the country on ThursdayArctic air is bringing freezing conditions this week Image: Getty ImagesByTim HanlonNews Reporter:,  Mar |commentsBrits are set to face snow up and down the country by Thursday with Arctic air bringing lows of -C this week.After a week of hot and sunny weather where the UK had higher temperatures than the south of Spain, now a new front is moving in from the north bringing unseasonably cold conditions.People will need to wrap up warm as the icy temperatures are set to cover all parts of the country and bringing with it a carpet of snow. Maps from WXCharts show temperatures getting colder as the week goes on and spreading further south. It could get as low as -C in central Scotland while it could also be -C on the south coast of England. There are likely to be widespread snow flurries on Thursday morning, with it sticking in the South East, according to the maps, and again on Saturday where there could be up to six or seven centimetres of snow in North Wales and northern England.  Met Office forecaster Aidan McGivern said: “Much colder weather is on the way and in places there will be snow by the middle of the week.”He continued: “Another area of rain pushing south across the Northern Isles, that is a cold front and it is going to be an important feature over the next few days as it sweeps south across the country. Shetland already in the Arctic air.” It is set to be a cloudy and grey start to Tuesday morning for the east of England and rain in the north and south.  “This area across Scotland mixing with cold air could bring some sleet and snow over the high grounds but that again is a fairly weak feature, said Mr McGivern. To the north of it though much colder air arrives, C to C in the far north of Scotland while temperatures stay above average further south although not as high as they have been with a lot more cloud cover than we have been used to recently. It will get a lot colder, though going into Wednesday. Here’s the cold front by Tuesday night it has become an increasingly important feature as it potentially reactivates with the cold air to bring some snow fall to places by Wednesday and Thursday, said Mr McGivern.  For the start of Tuesday night we are going to see a lot of cloud cover, some cloud, mist and fog in place and here’s the cold front, you can see some snow on it over the Pennines, rain mainly at lower levels. It is slowly sinking south but it’s iding the country in two with a frosty start for Scotland, in parts of the far north of England behind the front, and milder further south albeit with a cloud cover and a few bits of showery rain in places. UK forecast for the next  days Turning much colder and also more unsettled this week. Today: Occasional rain across southern England clearing slowly. Fog and low cloud in central areas retreating to eastern coasts, sunny intervals and scattered showers inland. Rain moving southwards into Scotland, followed by colder weather with wintry showers in the far north. Tonight: Rain and hill snow sinking further south, followed by snow and hail showers in north and east Scotland, with a risk of ice. Further south mostly dry and cloudy. Wednesday: Rain and hill snow continuing southwards bright but distinctly cold to the north, with heavy hail and snow showers. Parts of Wales and southern England seeing sunny intervals and showers. Outlook for Thursday to Saturday: Cold for all parts with rain, sleet and snow clearing south on Thursday morning. Further wintry showers for many parts through Thursday and Friday. Turning less cold by Saturday. title: barbie house market 385000 almost
story: Barbie house on the market for £, - and almost everything is pinkA house decked out almost entirely in shades of pink is up for sale for £, in Wigan, Greater Manchester, and it looks just like the sort of place Barbie herself would enjoy livingFrom the outside, the only hint of pink is the paint on the front door and garage Image: Jam Press PurplebricksByJulia BanimAudience WriterKatie Dollard:,  Mar |commentsA striking four-bedroom house is on the market for £,, and it would make for the perfect home for anyone who has ever fancied themselves as a bit of a Barbie Girl.From the outside, the house, which is in Wigan, Greater Manchester, looks very much like other houses on the street, with the blush pink front door and garage door being the only giveaways as to what it looks like inside.Potential buyers will feel like theyaposve popped on a pair of rose-tinted glasses as they walk around the house for the first time, with shades of pink and rose used in each of the four bedrooms, as well as throughout the open plan kitchen-diner, lounge area, and office.  Get the news you want straight to your inbox.for a Mirror newsletter here. The home comes unfurnished, however, the current owners have kept the pretty pink theme throughout, with the rooms filled with pink sofas, chairs, and even a snooker table. The property even has rose gold metalwork throughout.Colour scheme aside, the house includes a number of desirable features, including four double bedrooms on the first floor. An en-suite bathroom is attached to the master bedroom, while this floor also boasts a modern - and of course, pink-themed - family bathroom.  On the ground floor, residents can enjoy luxurious underfloor heating in all tiled areas as well as a spacious family lounge with a built-in modern fireplace media ball. Double French doors lead out from the kitchen diner into the back garden, where a gazebo would help make for the sort of perfect summer parties even Pool Party Barbie herself would be happy to attend.There, unfortunately, isnapost a Malibu-esque pool for you to splash about in, however, the house does boast pretty much everything  a sociable doll about town might desire. Catered for fun evenings at home with Ken, Stacey, Skipper, or whoever  might drop by, the property most notably includes a detached garage that has been converted into a beautul bar area.Whether they be plastic or human-sized, the lucky homeowner will also benefit from off-road parking and CCTV. The house is currently on the market for £, with Purple Bricks. Do you have a property-related story to share  We pay for stories. news weird-news chemist-urges-people-not-use-"Candles could be bad for your health, warns chemistByPaige HollandShowbiz Audience Writer:,  Mar |commentsCandles are a great addition to any home - not only do they make the place smell nice but they make it feel extra cosy too. But an expert has revealed they could be doing more harm than good.Dr. Dan Gubler, a PhD organic chemist, often shares health advice and tips on his TikTok @drdangublerwhere he has , followers.But his latest video, which has gone viral with . million views, has caused quite the stir as he warns people against using scented candles. In the video, he explains: There have been a lot of clinical studies that have come out recently showing that frequently burning indoor candles can cause serious health problems. For more of the news you care about, straight to your inbox, sign up for one of our daily newsletters here. Including inhibiting the ability of cells especially in the bladder to grow normally. When we think of pollution we think of it as an outdoor thing but indoor pollution caused by burning candles, air fresheners and other sources is a big problem. Candles are made out of cheap paraffin wax, they’re made out of articial fragrances and dyes and when we burn that it gives off carbon monoxide, carbon dioxide, sulfur dioxide Benzopyrene, and other volatile compounds. They’re not good for the body, they interfere with the body’s ability to reproduce. The problem with these candles is that there is no quality control. Candles manufacturers are not required and they do not show  per cent of their ingredients and they donapost have to prove safety. Weaposre just buying these and breathing it in and itaposs a big problem, so be careful. He adds: If you’re burning candles once in a while in a well-ventilated space I wouldn’t worry about it but chronically burning could be a big deal.Since being posted, his video has racked up almost , likes and , comments from people who were shocked by what they were hearing. One person said: Jesus. Can I have anything nice  No way thataposs crazy *lights candle,* joked another user. A third said: Itaposs literally everything. Iaposm so sick of this. CANDLES ARE MY MAIN SOURCE OF JOY. WHAT DO I HAVE LEFT  exclaimed someone .Have you got a story to share We want to hear all about it. title: friends blasted after getting matching
story: Friends blasted after getting matching tattoos as people call them trashyA pair of friends were roasted for getting matching tattoos to celebrate their close bond – trolls ripped into the duo on Reddit, where they called the designs "trashy"Two friends have been branded trashy after they got matching tattoos Image: Getty ImagesByJohn BettAudience WriterSophie RobertsLestyle and Travel Editor:,  Mar |comments Two women have been blasted online after sharing a picture of their matching tattoos - as people say itaposs apostrashyapos.The friends decided to get tattoos that complete each other, so when one holds out her arm to show her inking the other friend has to do the same.As the Daily Star reports, the messages they chose to get permanently inked onto their bodies read b***h guess what, and then b***h what One of the friends shared an image of the matching tattoos on Reddit with the caption Got matching tattoos with my bestie”, but users were not impressed. What do you think about the tattoos  Let us know in the comments...Not everyone was as impressed by the designs and the photo garnered a lot of attention on Reddit’s “Trashy” forum. One Redditor said: “Spot the morons.” Another remarked: “Sad. Mother must be proud.” And a third added: “I’m very upset about the lack of a comma in the first tattoo. It should read: “B*tch, guess what ” This is going to haunt me.” Despite the backlash, some defended the women.  For more of the news you care about, straight to your inbox, sign up for one of our daily newslettershere. One commenter said: “This isn’t trashy at all, it’s just people making mildly questionable choices. “They’re doin’ what makes them happy, why the f*** not.” Another agreed: “Aww those are cute.” A third wrote: “That’s actually funny. I wouldn’t get one though lol.” And a fourth added: “It’s kinda trashy to get profanity tattooed on your arm but, I’m honestly jealous of their friendship.” Do you have a story to sell  Get in touch with us at yourmirror@mirror Read MoreRead More Most Read Dont MissFollow MirrorFacebookTwitterComment MORE ON RedditTattoos" data-immediate"data-immediate" to FREE email alerts with news to brighten your daySubscribeInvalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.We use your sign-up to provide content in ways youve consented to and to improve our understanding of you. news weird-news i-cleaned-washing-machine-after-"TikTok user shares cleaning hack for washing machineByEmma RosemurgeyAudience Writer:,  Mar Updated:,  Mar |comments Over the last few years, a cleaning revolution has taken place on social media, with people from all over the world gaining impressive followings for sharing their hints and tricks for keeping their home clean and tidy.But regardless of whether youaposre the type of person who finds cleaning therapeutic or youaposd rather watch paint dry, itaposs fair to say weaposve all learned something along the way.Thanks to the likes of Mrs Hinch, sites like Facebook and TikTok are filled to the brim with things we never knew about how to keep our home clean - including this little washing machine hack. Washing machines quite obviously have the purpose of washing our clothes, but have you ever thought about the fact your washing machine needs to be washed too  No, I hadnapost really, either, until cleaning queen Faith Earle shared a hack on Facebook for cleaning the little drawer where the detergent goes. As someone who officially fits into the category of people who hate cleaning, it had never occurred to me that the drawerwould need to be cleaned, let alone how I would do it. However, Faithaposs recent post revealed something that lots of us didnapost know - you can actually remove the entire drawer to clean it properly, and have a good scrub around behind it. Taking to the Facebook group Cleaning tips and tricks with before and after pictures of her drawer, Faith wrote: How on earth did I not know this drawer came out !Iaposm now officially an adult and love cleaning haha! Thank you everyone for your cleaning tips and tricks. So, I decided to take a look at my own washing machine drawer, and letaposs just say the results were slightly horrying. Just like Faith said, it turned out there was a little button that allowed me to pull the drawer out completely, and what was hidden behind was an awful lot of mould and filth. I decided to soak the drawer itself in hot, soapy water, before giving it a good old scrub - but washing compartment where the drawer had been was a lot harder. To be perfectly honest, as someone who doesnapost really subscribe to the whole Mrs Hinch lestyle, I wasnapost really sure how to tackle it, but some boiling water, washing up liquid and a toothbrush made it a lot more presentable for now. Itaposs quite grim to think about all the mould that was sitting in a machine which is supposed to leave things cleaner - not more dirty - but until someone invents a self-cleaning washing machine, letaposs spread the word on keeping that pesky drawer clean.Do you have a story to share  We want to hear all about it. title: most popular dog names 2022
story: Most popular dog names of  so far as Boris falls off Kennel Clubs listThe Kennel Club Pet Insurance has revealed the most popular male and female dog names for  so far - and says many are thought to have been inspired by Nasa projectsThe Kennel Club has revealed the most popular names for  so far Image: Getty Images pxByPaige FreshwaterContent Editor:,  Mar |commentsWhen naming a new puppy, some owners can spend hours searching through names and their meanings.While others might hold off until they bring their new pet home, waiting for their personality to shine through before naming them. The Kennel Club Pet Insurance has revealed the most popular dog names for  so far, with the name Boris falling off their list. A statement reads: Borisaposs popularity is plummeting according to the latest analysis - of names given to dogs.After the  December election the popularity of the name Boris for dogs soared, with  puppies named Boris in  - according to Agria Pet Insurance, providers of Kennel Club Pet Insurance.to our TeamDogs newsletter for your weekly dose of dog news, pictures and stories. Rover has increased by  percent in a year as space-themed names make a comeback, in athought to be inspired by Nasa projects.Over the last five years, the UKaposs favourite dog names have largely stayed the same, with Bella, Willow, Daisy and Lola coming out on top for female pets, and Teddy, Milo, Buddy and Reggie leading the charge for male dogs. Captain Tom Moore has secured a sentimental place in the nation’s heart with the names Captain and Tom rising in popularity, the statement adds. There were over  per cent more puppies named Captain and over  per cent more named Tom registered in  compared to pre-pandemic. However, the female names Roxi, Libby and Peach have all fallen off the list for female dogs, alongside the male names Spike, Nacho and Alan. The most popular names for  so far, according to The Kennel Club Pet Insurance: Top  male puppy names:Teddy Milo Buddy Puppy Reggie Cooper Loki Max Charlie BaileyTop  female puppy names:Bella Willow Daisy Lola Ruby Poppy Rosie Mabel Bonnie NalaDo you have a dog story to share  Email paige.freshwater@reachplc. news weird-news people-stitches-dad-wearing-cone-"Man wears cone after dog has surgery to make him feel ‘less lonely’ByNia DaltonSpecialist Writer:,  Mar |comments A dad and a dog have touched the nationaposs hearts after they were both captured wearing matching aposcones of shameapos on camera. The TikTok -famous pup, Good Boy Ollie, was filmed sitting on the sofa alongside his dad after having surgery on his eye.In a bid to make Ollie feel less lonely, his dad sported a pink cone around his neck while attempting to sip a cup of tea. Ollieaposs owner, Alex Morgan, posted the amusing video of her family on TikTok, captioned: Is it just my dad She titled the uplting clip : Not my dad wearing a cone to make my dog feel less lonely after his surgery, then said: I swear itaposs always the dads who didnapost want a dog that end up loving them the most.  to our TeamDogs newsletter for your weekly dose of dog news, pictures and stories. Alexaposs dad is videoed stroking the brown Labrador retriever with one hand, while holding a mug in the other and watching television. The viral footage has reached more than . million people, with thousands falling in love with her dadaposs devotion to her dog. One person said: Protect at all costs!!! Best dog dad ever!!! while another commented: Not all heroes wear capes … they wear cones.Many viewers were puzzled by the cup of tea and addressed her dadaposs multitasking, with a fan questioning: How’s he drinking that brew  Alex reassured followers that Ollie was doing great after his small operation to remove a lump from his eyelid. On his Instagram, she said: Dogs grow little lumps and bumps, but we just wanted to be on the safe side and test it. Ollie has been such a good boy and we’re super thankful to have such amazing vets who take great care of him. Good Boy Ollie is well-known on the social media  as the aposBooty Balance Kingapos for hilariously balancing objects on his bottom.From a full glass of water to a ukulele and a toilet roll, Lab Ollie has perfected his party trick and can hold just about anything.The special dog has over . million followers and growing on TikTok and Instagram and often dresses up in funny costumes, remakes popular films and plays tricks on his parents. title: pilot shares worst time fly
story: Pilot shares worst time to fly for nervous travellers - and where to sit on planeJerry Johnson, an airline pilot from Los Angeles, in the US, has revealed the worst time to flyyoure a nervous traveller as its likely theyd expect more "bumpier air"ByPaige HollandShowbiz Audience WriterChristine YounanSenior Lestyle and Travel Reporter:,  Mar Updated:,  Mar |commentsBeing afraid of flying is one of the most common phobias.In fact, it is believed that one in  of the population is affected byit, according to Anxiety UK.Whether itaposs the turbulence, the landings, take-offs, claustrophobia, heights or bad weather, there are a number of things that can trigger the anxiety that comes with flying. If this sounds like you, youaposll be pleased to know a pilot has some advice to make the journey that bit easier.Jerry Johnson, an airline pilot from Los Angeles, US, has revealed the worst time of the day to flyyouaposre a nervous traveller, reports Daily Star.For more of the news you care about, straight to your inbox, sign up for one of our daily newsletters here.He shared his flight secrets and top tips with Readeraposs Digest where he said thereaposs a time of the day to avoid a bumpy ride.Jerry revealed: If youaposre a nervous flyer, book a morning flight. The heating of the ground later causes bumpier air, and itaposs much more likely to thunderstorm in the afternoon. Another anonymous pilot also suggested that passengers should sit in the backthey always feel cold.The cabin crew member, who works in Texas, said: The general flow of air in any airplane is from front to back. They added: Soyouaposre concerned about breathing the freshest possible air or not getting too hot, sit as close to the front. Planes are generally warmest in the back. For a smooth ride, sit over or near the wing pilot Patrick Smith says. The bumpiest place is in the back. A plane is like a seesaw. If youaposre in the middle, you donapost move as much, he revealed.He also reassured readers that turbulence isnapost dangerous and that itaposs impossible for it to cause the plane to crash. Patrick added: Pilots find it perplexing that so many people are afraid of turbulence. Itaposs all but impossible for turbulence to cause a crash. We avoid turbulence not because weaposre afraid the wing is going to fall off but because itaposs annoying.Have you got a story to share We want to hear all about it. news weird-news woman-makes-stylish-vase-using-"TikToker creates vase using fabric softener bottlerByJulia BanimAudience WriterRia Newman:,  Mar |comments After spotting a £ fluted glass vase online, -year-old Teresa Clarke longed for one just like it for her own home. However, she knew she couldn’t justy spending so much on a vase, so set about thinking up a creative - and very thrty - solution.NHS nurse Teresa, from Essex, decided to try making her own vase using something of a similar shape that she already had knocking about the house – a normal bottle of Lenor Outdoorable Fabric Softener.The end result, which set Teresa back a snippy £, looked as on-trend as anything you might find in the shops, saving her £ when compared to the pricey one sheaposd seen online.  Get the news you want straight to your inbox.for a Mirror newsletter here. Teresa began by removing both the label and lid from the empty bottle, before using spray paint to give it the exact colour she wanted. She then wrapped string around the bottle top so as to hide the tell-tale grooves, before leaving it to dry. Guests would probably have no idea as to the cheap and cheerful origin of Teresaaposs fashionable, patterned vase unless she told them so herself, with her creation perfectly complimenting her stylish home decor.Teresa said: “I knew exactly which bottle I would use – I just love the pattern on them. [...] “I already had the empty bottle but they are usually about £ in the local supermarkets.“I picked up a £ can of  Natural Hessian chalk spray paint from Poundland. The string I already had, but you can usually pick that up for £. By making my own vase I saved myself £. She continued: “I absolutely love it. The string on the neck and the Natural Hessian colour gives it that rustic look, while the pattern effect on the stylish column silhouette adds elegance.Shared photos of the finished look via a Facebook post, Teresa wrote: “I love the patterns on these Lenor Outdoorable fabric softener Bottles from @joyofclean so I thought, why not get out the spray paint, some string and make myself a nice decorative vase.“Obviously it may not be to everyone’s taste but I love the patterns on it and I really like how dferent it looks from a normal vase. I’m going to try it with other shaped bottles that we throw away and see how they turn out. Facebook friends admired her inventiveness and were wowed by the very professional-looking end result. One person commented, “Absolutely gorgeous!!! I often wondered what you could use these bottles for. Brilliant idea, while another wrote, “I love this, it came out so beautully. A third said: “That’s lovely! I must try this thank you, I would love to try the stone effect spray paint on it too.Do you have a money-saving hack to share  We pay for stories. title: woman stitches after boohoo coat
story: Woman in stitches after Boohoo coat leaves her looking like a giant bin bagA woman has been left laughing after trying on her new coat from Boohoo - as she ended up looking like a bin bag after the item failed to meet her expectationsThe woman hoped her coat would look like the modelled version Image: @girlbossadventure TikTokByZahna EklundAudience writer:,  Mar |commentsSometimes, we buy clothes online and find ourselves disappointed when the product we receive looks completely dferent on us than it did on the model on the website.And one woman has found out the hard way that some clothes just donapost suit everyone after she bought a shiny black coat from Boohoo which failed to meet her expectations. The woman shared a video on TikTok in which she showed off the version of the coat that was modelled on Instagram and called it the biggest clothing fail sheaposs ever had.She then filmed herself wearing the item - and couldnapost help but draw comparisons between the material of the coat and a black bin bag that you might use in your wheelie bin.  Get the news you want straight to your inbox.for a Mirror newsletter here.In a video on her @girlbossadventure account, she said: I had to share this with you guys to give you a giggle.I ordered this coat from Boohoo and I was so excited. But I literally look like a giant bin bag. Does not look like it looks on the model, Iaposm a bin bag. Iaposm actually a bin bag. And to make matters worse, the woman had managed to get herself stuck inside the coat - meaning she now had to keep styling out the fashion fail until her partner could rescue her.She added: Also, Iaposm stuck in it. Iaposm stuck, Iaposve got myself stuck in the zip. So Iaposm waiting for [my partner] to come home and rescue me. Boohoo has been contacted for comment.The woman isnapost the only person to have shared their clothing disasters online recently either, as we also told how Holly Smith was left disappointed when she picked up a PrettyLittleThing coat modelled by Molly-Mae Hague.Holly thought the long Teddy coat would look stylish for her trips to the shops, but instead, she claimed it made her look like she was wearing a dressing gown. She said: PrettyLittleThing, you have done me dirty. This is what I wanted, the nice Teddy coat as seen on Molly-Mae, but this is what I got. I went out in this and someone came up to me and said aposSometimes I go out wearing my dressing gown too.apos This is not a coat, PrettyLittleThing, this is a dressing gown!Do you have a story to sell  Get in touch with us at yourmirror@trinitymirror .Read MoreRead More Most Read Dont MissFollow MirrorFacebookTwitterComment MORE ON BoohooTikTokViral" data-immediate"data-immediate" to FREE email alerts with news to brighten your daySubscribeInvalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.We use your sign-up to provide content in ways youve consented to and to improve our understanding of you. title: woman sets new world record
story: Woman sets new world record by scoffing most chicken nuggets in a minuteLeah Shutkever flew past the previous record when she snaffled an impressive  McDonalds chicken nuggets in  seconds, with the nuggets weighing in at a total of gLeah Shutkever smashed the world record for most chicken nuggets eaten in a minute Image: Guiness World RecordsByLucas CumiskeyKit Roberts:,  Mar |commentsA British woman has trounced the competition and set a new world record for the most chicken nuggets eaten in one minute. Leah Shutkever smashed through the previous record when she scoffed down  of the poultry treats in the allotted time. The chicken gobbled by serial record-breaker Shutkever had an impressive total weight of g. Her efforts obliterated the record set by fellow competitive eater Nela Zissar, who managed to snarf a mind-boggling g of nuggets in . But Leah didnapost stop at the sprint section of nugget-eating, also setting a new record for the most nuggets put away in three minutes, a test of endurance as much as speed.  In  she managed to chow down on .g of nuggets in  seconds. This edged past the previous record of g, which had been held by fellow Brit Thomas Welborn. Leah, from the West Mids, set her latest nugget achievement while backstage at the Guinness World Records Italian TV show, Lo Show Dei Records, in Milan.  The good egg holds a slew of world gongs for eating quickly, including her  accolade for fastest time to ingest three mince pies . She also crammed down three pickled eggs in a record . seconds in  and ate eight tomatoes in a minute in . The foodie also set records for eating a muffin in . seconds and for devouring the most marshmallows in a minute by eating , using no hands for either. title: woman tells how skin started
story: Womans skin suddenly started to bleed and ooze after stopping eczema treatmentNicola Barton, from Glasgow, had been applying steroid cream to treat the eczema with good results, but had a violent reaction when she stopped using the treatment for the skin conditionNicola Barton was left with oozing skin as a result of eczema Image: Jam Press Nicola BartonByAmy WaltersKit Roberts:,  Mar |comments A woman has revealed the stomach-churning symptoms she has endured after she stopped using eczema creams - including her skin sticking to her bedsheets after it began aposoozingapos.Nicola Barton, , started to experience symptoms of eczema when she was only four years old, saying she would have to dress up aposlike a mummyapos each evening to help with the itching.After being prescribed steroid creams and using them sparingly the condition was reduced to a few patches on her arms.However after Nicola, a receptionist from Glasgow, turned  the eczema started to flare up again.She had just ed home from a trip to Australia, and thinks the sudden change in temperature could have been a factor in the condition worsening. Doctors once again prescribed Nicola steroid creams, and despite providing some initial relief the eczema proved more stubborn. “I started researching on my own because what the doctors could do wasn’t working at all,” Nicola said. I had some really aggressive, painful patches and I didn’t realise it was eczema again. The steroids took away the eczema almost immediately, but would always come back more aggressive.“I used things like shea butter, jojoba oil and vitamin E oil on my skin instead of moisturisers with chemicals in them and these helped a lot. “I was learning a bit more about alternatives to synthetic treatments, but hadn’t learned about topical steroid withdrawalat this point, so still used the weak steroids.”In January , she discovered people on Instagram who had been documenting their journey with TSW – an adverse reaction to discontinuing steroids after a period of usage. As she wasn’t using very strong steroids, Nicola thought that the condition wouldn’t affect her, so she continued to use her medication. But struggling to cope with the painful condition, she decided to stop using the creams once and for all in November . Quickly, her skin deteriorated dramatically. Nicola said: “I started to flare, ooze, crack, swell and bleed within a few days of stopping.“Initially, it felt like out-of-control eczema and just kept spreading, then within a couple of days the other symptoms started. “My skin would ooze wherever I had patches of inflamed and painful skin, which eventually ended up being most of my body after a couple of weeks. “I was aware [of the symptoms] because of the people who decided to document their healing process online, but I was convinced my withdrawal wouldn’t be that bad.“It was so incredibly dry, that I could barely move my joints and I couldn’t fully close my hands, bend my knees and elbows or even turn my head because my neck would crack, bleed and ooze. “My body stopped regulating its temperature, so I’d be sweating when I wasn’t hot and I lost my appetite, where I lost lbs.” Nicola began losing her hair and believes she lost over half during her ordeal, which she cut short due to it being so thin.  As her ears used to crack and ooze, they would end up sticking to the pillow and because her skin was so itchy, she couldn’t find a comfy way to sleep. Although she didn’t feel great about her appearance, her mental health has taken the biggest toll. Nicola said: “I was in so much pain and discomfort and just wanted my skin to feel better again.“I would happily look like this foreverI could just feel better. Obviously I’d rather not have all my skin open for the rest of my le, but at the time I’d have taken any relief. “It was without a doubt the worst experience of my le, as it was incredibly traumatic and there was never a single second where I felt comfortable or pain free. “I didn’t want to deal with it and looking back on it, I have no idea how I actually got through it – especially because I had no idea when it would end.“I barely left my house during the worst, but I was asked a couple of timesI was contagious and was told by the doctor that I looked like I had ‘elephant skin.’ “My partner, Jack Jones, , has been amazing and is one the reasons I managed to make it through each day. “He was basically my carer when I lost the ability to do most things, as he washed my hair, helped brush my teeth and bandaged me every night without fail.“I have a lot of sympathy for those [caring for others with TSW] because it isn’t easy watching your loved one go through such a traumatic experience.” Nicola believes that the experience has made self-acceptance easier for her and as she’s now  months free of steroid use, she feels more comfortable in her looks than ever before. She added: “Right now, my skin is better than it was before and even though I have scars and wrinkly skin, I think I look absolutely fine.“I still get flare-ups of dry, itchy skin in the cold weather which scares me and I start to worry I’m going to go through it again. “I don’t blame doctors and I know that’s a common feeling, as they’re doing what they were taught to do – but it annoys me when some refuse to listen. “Steroids have always been the treatment for eczema, so it’s hard to change minds, but all they have to do is look at how many people have gone through this and got better by doing nothing to our skin. “It isn’t a coincidence that we all get better eventually once we stop steroids, as topical steroid withdrawal isn’t eczema.” Read MoreRead More Most Read Dont MissFollow MirrorFacebookTwitterComment MORE ON Jack JonesMental healthVitaminsElephantsSteroidsHealth" data-immediate"data-immediate"Get our daily health briefing with all the news you need to know direct to your inboxInvalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.We use your sign-up to provide content in ways youve consented to and to improve our understanding of you. title: roman abramovich gave putin handwritten
story: Roman Abramovich gave Putin handwritten note from Zelensky prompting savage replyIt comes after reports the Cha FC owner has been flying between Moscow and Kyiv to relay messages between Putin and Zelensky in a bid to help with a potential peace agreementLast week, the Kremlin has confirmed outgoing Cha owner was involved in early peace talks following the Russian invasion of Ukraine Image: PAByAbigail OLearyNews Reporter:,  Mar |commentsRoman Abramovich reportedly gave Putin a handwritten note from Ukraineaposs president Zelensky, prompting a savage reply from the Russian leader. It comes after reports the Cha FC owner has been flying between Moscow and Kyiv to relay messages between Putin and Zelensky. After relaying a message to Putin about potential terms of a peace agreement, Putin reportedly told Abramovich apostell him I will thrash themapos.Last week, the Kremlin has confirmed outgoing Cha owner was involved in early peace talks following the Russian invasion of Ukraine, reports the Mail Online.President Vladimir Putin ordered his troops into the neighbouring country in late February, starting a bloody conflict which has been condemned by the vast majority of countries around the world.The war in Ukraine led to heightened scrutiny of Russians living in the United Kingdom on so-called aposGolden Visasapos. Abramovich was one such oligarch with assets worth billions in the UK, so claims he was playing a part in initial peace negotiations were met with surprise.Those reports were not backed up by Russian government officials at the time but a Kremlin spokesperson has now confirmed the -year-old was involved. He did take part at the initial stage, Dmitry Peskov, Putinaposs press secretary, said of Abramovich on Thursday. Now the negotiations are between the two teams, the Russians and Ukrainians.Abramovichaposs mother, Irina, was born in Ukraine and his daughter, Sofia, has posted on social media to declare it is only Putin who wants a war with Ukraine.A spokesperson for the Cha owner - who bought the club in  and is now selling up - released a statement four days after Putinaposs invasion which said: I can confirm that Roman Abramovich was contacted by the Ukrainian side for support in achieving a peaceful resolution, and that he has been trying to help ever since.Considering what is at stake, we would ask for your understanding as to why we have not commented on neither the situation as such nor his involvement. Thank you.Abramovichaposs role in the early peace talks was also confirmed by Ukrainian film director and producer Alexander Rodnyansky, who said: I can confirm that the Ukrainian side have been trying to find someone in Russia willing to help them in finding a peaceful resolutionThey are connected to Roman Abramovich through the Jewish community and reached out to him for help. Roman Abramovich has been trying to mobilise support for a peaceful resolution ever since.  Although Roman Abramovichaposs influence is limited, he is the only one who responded and taken it upon himself to try. If this will have an impact or not, I donapost know, but I am in contact with Zelenskyaposs staff myself, and know that they are grateful for his genuine efforts.Russian officials have also hit back at Joe Biden ’s jibe that “butcher” Vladimir Putin “cannot stay in power” by branding the US leader “weak, sick and deluded”.Moscow deployed its loyal attack dogs on Kremlin-controlled TV to claim the US leader should undergo a “medical examination” because he is incapable of “soberly” assessing reality. Putin’s own spokesman Dmitry Peskov said: We donapost know what President Biden meant, we know what he said.  “And what he said in general in his speech suggests that he is a victim of numerous delusions.”Speaker of the Russian parliament Vyacheslav Volodin branded Biden a “weak and sick man”, guilty of “hysteria” by branding Putin a “butcher” for the bloodshed in Ukraine.He said: The US president’s behaviour might be “professionally explained by psychiatrists” but “from a male point of view, the weak behave this way. “US citizens should be ashamed of their president. “Perhaps, he is sick. It would be right for Biden to undergo a medical examination.” Read MoreRead More Most Read Dont MissFollow MirrorFacebookTwitterComment MORE ON Vyacheslav VolodinDmitry PeskovRoman AbramovichJoe BidenVladimir PutinPolitics" data-immediate"data-immediate"Get UK politics insight with our free daily email briefing straight to your inboxInvalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.We use your sign-up to provide content in ways youve consented to and to improve our understanding of you. title: secret new luxury home teen
story: Secret new ‘luxury home of teen Putin love child’ unmasked thanks to food delivery ordersA hacked food courier database showing deliveries to Vladimir Putins “love child” Luiza Rozova, , has allegedly revealed the teens new "palace luxury" homeA new luxury penthouse has been linked to Vladimir Putins secret daughter Image: Hod   eastwest newsByWill StewartRussia Correspondent:,  Mar Updated:,  Mar |comments A new home boasting “palace luxury” linked to Vladimir Putin’s “secret daughter” and her mother - the strongman’s alleged ex-lover - has been located in St Petersburg.The pair were earlier claimed to share a £. million home in Monaco but now a spacious penthouse has evidently come to light via a hacked food courier database showing deliveries to “love child” Luiza Rozova, . It’s value before the recent slump due to the war and sanctions was around £. million. Luiza, a student, is the daughter of cleaner-turned-multimillionaire Svetlana Krivonogikh, , now part-owner of a major Russian bank, one of the countryaposs wealthiest women with an estimated £ million financial and property fortune. She has not commented on claims that her daughter was fathered by the Kremlin president, and nor has Luiza, also known as Elizaveta, although the teenager told Russian GQ that she “probably” looks “similar” to a young Putin.The suspicion that she was Putin’s secret daughter from an extra-marital affair was first aired by an independent media outlet in Russia which was later blocked by the authorities. The , square feet apartment in the sumptuous gated Fontanka  block is one of St Petersburg’s most sought after addresses in the city’s “Golden Triangle”. It is described as a “club house” with an array of “elite apartments” with construction by German company Engel  Voelkers, with “high-end” designer finishes and furnishings by Roberto Molon in an elegant and light art deco style”. Plumbing and kitchen appliances are from leading German and Italian manufacturers”.  In the prestigious development “everything is thought out to create maximum comfort, convenience and a fabulous atmosphere of beauty, comfort and coziness. “It has its own wellness centre with a swimming pool, and luxury service.” It offers “palace luxury in the spirit of modernity from Italian designers”. Reports say that Oleg Yemelyanov - linked to jailed opposition leader Alexei Navalny - analysed hacked Yandex Food records which became publicly available.  These showed an unknown apartment linked to Krivonogikh at Fontanka embankment number , he said. “Wow, Putin’s [ex-]mistress Svetlana Krivonogikh has a flat with total area of nearly  square metres on the River Fontanka embankment,” said Yemelyanov. “Thanks for the tip to Luiza Vladimirovna [Rozova] who has been ordering food to that address.” The propertyaposs value has sunk to £. million in the past month. Luiza has closed her Instagram after she was hit by a wave of extreme trolling over Russia’s war in Ukraine.One comment said: “Are U sitting in the bunker   Like a rat ” Luiza - who had , subscribers - stopped publicly posting six months ago, triggering the suspicion that Putin had gagged her, but her account remained open. Now a message says in Russian: “User not found.”  One post on the -year-old’s Instagram alleged she was the “daughter of a murderer, war criminal, psychopath and drug addict”. Many posts included the Ukrainian blue-and-yellow flag and one carried the message: “The Russian nation must rise against this dictator. You donapost want to have anything to do with him.” But commenters also staunchly defended her, with one saying: “Donapost judge her...is not her fault.” Another wrote: “She cannot do anything for having a crazy father”. One more said: “Come on guys, she is just a person. She is not guilty.”  But a commenter called Martina hit back: “Yes, she is guilty of passive complicity. It is the same as most of the Germans in the Nazi period.” Another posted: “Call him -he loves you ... maybe you can convince him not to kill.” One complained: Stop writing [that] sheaposs an innocent. “She is the daughter of that devil! “She could at least show that she does not agree with what her father is doing, somehow influence him. “Putin doesnapost give a s*** for ordinary people, but maybe his daughters still mean something to him. “She stays quiet because she knowsshe says one bad word to Daddy, she will be cut off from big money, apartments and expensive things.  “Unfortunately, there are important things - and more important things. “Apparently, purses and villas are more important to her than human le.” Putin has two daughters by his ex-we Lyudmila, the former Kremlin first lady. Likewise, neither of them - Dr Maria Vorontsova, , a geneticist, and Katerina Tikhonova, , a high-kicking ‘rock’n’roll’ dancer-turned-mathematician, have commented on the war. There are reports that Putin has hidden some family members in a chalet in neutral Switzerland - while another version is that they are in a five-star hi-tech nuclear bunker in Siberia. There is speculation he has up to four children with Olympic Gold-medal winning rhythmic gymnast Alina Kabaeva, , now high-earning a media mogul in Moscow who is rarely seen in public. This would make the Kremlin strongman a father of seven. Luiza has had a higher online public profile, and was hit by a backlash over Ukraine.  One comment said: “How are you in the bunker ” A troll suspecting she may be in her mother’s Mediterranean bolthole said: “While you’re fluffing around in Monaco, people of your generation are dying in Ukraine because of your father. “Your destiny will be that of Marija Milosevic when your dad gets sent to The Hague. “SHOW YOUR FACE YOU COWARD!” She was told: “Young Russian soldiers are being sent to Ukraine without any knowledge about where they are, who they fight and what they do. “The Russian economy is collapsing, reaching absolute zero. “Soon,not already, you wonapost be able to use Netflix, Spoty, social media apps, pay with Google and Apple Pay, all popular brands and boycotting and exiting Russia.”Luiza was also told: “Many Ukrainians have forgotten about what sleep is, and even more so in bed. “After all, falling asleep, many of us run the risk of not waking up. “People spend the night in basements like rats because bombs are falling from the sky and rockets are coming. “All you need is not to be silent, not to stand aside. “ Tell people the truth about what is happening in Ukraine! “We want to live in peace and sleep peacefully in our beds, to know that in the morning our relatives and friends will be alive.” Luiza earlier showed her le at cafes, on trips to Paris, and running her own Russian fashion label. A video shows her at the Louvre museum during the pandemic. She was also seen working as an in-demand DJ. title: worse come putin after peace
story: Worse to come from Putin after peace talk delegates poisoned, expert warnsProfessor Michael Osterholm has warned Western leaders to bolster their preparations for a biological and chemical attack after Roman Abramovich and two members of the Ukraine peace talks were allegedly poisonedVladimir Putin seemingly has no qualms about using chemical weapons against his foes, an expert said Image: Getty ImagesByMatthew DreschNews Reporter:,  Mar Updated:,  Mar |comments Russiaaposs alleged poisoning of Roman Abramovich and other members of the Ukraine peace talks is a warning sign for the future, an expert said.Professor Michael Osterholm, an infectious disease expert, urged Western leaders to aposbolsterapos preparations for a biological and chemical attack following the suspected attack.The University of Minnesota academic warned that Vladimir Putin could also target political foes with his arsenal of deadly illegal weapons.It comes after Russian oligarch Mr Abramovich was allegedly poisoned alongside two Ukrainian peace negotiators earlier this month. The trio suffered symptoms including red eyes, painful tearing and peeling skin following their meeting in Kyiv. The professor warned that chemical weapons could also be used by Russia to break the stalemate in Ukraine. He added: However implausible a biological or chemical attack once seemed, the United States and its NATO allies need to game out the worst-case scenarios, take inventory of the resources they have at their collective disposal to deal with biological and chemical attacks, and swtly bolster those resources.Just a few weeks ago, the notion that Russia might use such weapons in its campaign in Ukraine would have seemed unduly alarmist. That is no longer the case.  Prof Osterholm added that Putin also aposseemingly has no compunctionapos about using banned weapons against his political enemies. The academic said biological and chemical weapons can achieve in war what bombs and bullets cannot - by reaching civilians hiding in shelters. He warned that poisonous gas could leave areas of Ukraine uninhabitable, while weaponised diseases could spread across the world. It comes after Russian opposition leader Alexei Navalny was poisoned with Novichok - just like former Kremlin spy Sergei Skripal and his daughter Yulia.  The father and daughter were attacked in Salisbury in , while Mr Navalny was poisoned in . In , Putin critic and ex-spy Alexander Litvinenko died in London after being poisoned with radioactive polonium-. Now Cha owner Abramovich, , has allegedly been poisoned while taking part in Ukraine peace talks. The suspected attack has been blamed on hard-liners in Moscow who wanted to foil talks to end the war.  It remains unclear what has caused the symptoms, which may have been triggered by a chemical or biological agent, or a form of electromagnetic-radiation attack. An investigation into the incident was launched by Christo Grozev and a German forensic team was brought in to perform examinations. However, too much time passed between the initial poisoning and these tests, so the suspected poison was unable to be detected. Mr Grozev concluded that the attack was a warning rather than an attempt to kill negotiators. Want all the latest news and analysis from Ukraine to our World News Bulletin here Mr Abramovich - who took over at Stamford Bridge in  - is said to have travelled back and forth from Moscow, Lviv and other negotiating venues as part of his role in talks, which his spokesperson confirmed on  February. I can confirm that Roman Abramovich was contacted by the Ukrainian side for support in achieving a peaceful resolution, and that he has been trying to help ever since, a statement read. Considering what is at stake, we would ask for your understanding as to why we have not commented on neither the situation as such nor his involvement. Thank you. story: We are excited to announce a new home for the Eveningcontent online, with a bigger and better website in partnership with The Courier. We have spoken to our readers, and our aim is to deliver you everything that you need to know, together in one place.If you are a subscriber or thinking about joining our digital community, find out what it means for you below.In order to give you access to the news that you need, we have expanded our newsrooms and created dedicated news teams to serve you and our extended local communities across Tayside and Fe. We will deliver you more content, live news as it happens, as well as breaking crime news and the latest from court, together in one place. We have also found new ways of telling our stories online, from in-depth investigations through to full- documentaries and podcasts.There is no change to The Courier and the Eveningnewspaper or ePapers. The newspapers will continue to be available for purchase at your local store, delivered to your home, or as an ePaper . We will continue to deliver you the best stories in print, that you have come to expect from The Courier and the Evening .Our ePapers are a full replica version of the newspaper, published online,  days a week. You can access The Courier and the EveningePaper via our dedicated ePaper apps where you can save and share stories, access all the paper supplements easily via their dedicated menu and even play interactive puzzles!If you would like to find out more about subscribing to The Courier or the EveningePaper, please contact our Digital News Subscriptions Team on    Monday – Friday, am – pm, or email.Your subscription to The Courier will allow you to access all of the Eveningstories which are now available on The Courier website. All of the best Eveningcontent, including columnists and football analysis will now appear on The Courier website and will be available for you as part of your subscription. If you have an ePaper subscription there will be no change as to how you access your Courier ePaper.The new website is now live. Eveningcontent can now be found on The Courier website.When you purchased your subscription an email was sent to your account with your login details. To reset your password please use the following link.Please contact our Digital News Subscriptions Team, on    Monday # Friday, am # pm, or email.Your subscription will continue as normal and all your existing subscriber benefits will remain in place. There are changes as to how you access your subscription benefits. See below, depending on what type of subscription you have.If you are an existing EveningWeb subscriber, you can log in to your account as normal through The Courier website.If you have an ePaper subscription you can access your ePaper on The Courier website here.Or via a new link in your Daily ePaper email.There is no change to your reoccurring billing agreement. If you purchase a new subscription through The Courier website the price is subject to change and may be more than your current subscription. If you have any questions about your current subscription or how to access your subscription benefits in the future, please contact our Digital News Subscription Team on   , or email.The new website is now live. Eveningcontent can now be found on The Courier website.Your subscription will continue as normal and all your existing subscriber benefits will remain in place. You can access your ePaper on The Courier website.Or via a new link in your Daily ePaper email.If you have any questions about your current subscription or how to access your subscription benefits in the future, please contact our Digital News Subscription Team on   , or email.Yes, we will still send you a daily ePaper reminder with a link to the EveningePaper, every time there is a new ePaper available .No, the Evening  ePaper app will remain exactly the same. If you are an existing EveningWeb subscriber, you can log in to your account as normal through The Courier website here.If you have an ePaper subscription you can access your ePaper on The Courier website here.Or via a new link in your Daily ePaper email.Yes, your existing Eveninglogin details work on The Courier. To log in please visit www.thecourier login.If you have any problems logging in, please contact our Digital News Subscription Team on   , or email.When you purchased your subscription an email was sent to your account with your login details. To reset your password please use the following link.No, your existing reoccurring billing agreement will not change. If you cancel this agreement you can still purchase a new subscription in the future through The Courier website. The price is subject to change and may be more than your current subscription.If you need any advice about your current or future subscription options please contact the Digital News Subscription team, on    Monday # Friday, am # pm or via email.Please contact our Digital News Subscriptions Team, on    Monday # Friday, am # pm, or email.The Eveningwebsite is no longer available. If you navigate to the Eveningwebsite or have website links saved, you will be automatically redirected to The Courier website.Yes. You will find all the content that you would have normally found at the Eveninghere .Our combined newsroom will deliver you all of the Eveningcontent that you would expect from The Tele website, plus more! We will continue to bring you the very best local news, football insight and in-depth features, as well as your favourite Eveningcolumnists. These can all be found on The Courier website as well as live news # updated as it happens # breaking crime news and the latest from the courts. You can also find our very best content that was published originally on the Eveningwebsite. These articles will be marked as originally appearing on the Eveningwebsite.Some Eveningcontent will be moved to The Courier website. Your bookmarked links will automatically redirect to the corresponding page on The Courier website.Yes, The Courier and the Eveningsocial pages will continue. We will curate content specically for our audiences through our Facebook, Twitter and Instagram channels. All articles will link to The Courier website.Your registration details that you set up on the Eveningwebsite will work on The Courier website. Please log in to your account as normal via the top right hand corner of the website or with this link.If you have forgotten your login or password please click the password reset link and follow the instructions.Yes. All registered users can access  free articlesevery  days. You now have access to  free articles on the new site. Please note, this information is correct at the time of publication, however, DC Thomson reserve the right to change this in the future.No, you will no longer receive Eveningbranded newsletters. You will now receive Courier newsletters. If you do not wish to receive these, click the #unsubscribe# link at the bottom of the newsletter email.The Courier has a Web subscription available which will give you access to all content on site from The Courier and the Evening . You can purchase a Courier Web or Courier ePaper subscription here: www.thecourier subscribeThe EveningePaper subscription is still available for purchase here.If you need help deciding what subscription is best for you, our Digital News Subscriptions Team are standing by to help. Please call on    Monday # Friday, am # pm, or email.No, there is only one Web subscription available on The Courier. The Courier Web subscription will give you access to all content on site from The Courier and the Evening . You can purchase a Courier Web or Courier ePaper subscription here .If you have an existing EveningWeb subscription then all your subscription benefits are now available on The Courier site. You have access to a bigger and better website, with all your favourite Tele content plus more.If you need help deciding what subscription is best for you, our Digital News Subscriptions Team are standing by to help. Please call on    Monday # Friday, am # pm, or email.You can purchase an EveningePaper subscription here.Yes, you can. Our ePapers are an exact digital replica of the newspaper and carry unique content in both titles. You can purchase both The Courier and the EveningePaper subscription’s here.

story: FORCE of nature Mary Lee, who died last week aged , once beat Dame Vera Lynn to the title of UK’s most popular singer. Born Mary Ann McDevitt in a Kinning Park tenement in , the daughter of a Glasgow lorry driver first started singing in church choirs and doing impressions for friends and family.
